DOCNAME: CASE OF KRASNOV AND SKURATOV v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: No violation of P1-3 in respect of Mr Krasnov;Violation of P1-3 in respect of Mr Skuratov;No separate issue under Art. 14;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE and the second applicant in DATE . They both live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the general elections to ORG of GPE , the lower chamber of the NORP bicameral legislature , were held to elect CARDINAL members for a term of DATE . CARDINAL of the members ( CARDINAL seats ) were returned by a majority vote from single - mandate district constituencies . The other CARDINAL seats were allocated on a proportional basis to candidates on federal rolls submitted by political parties or electoral blocs that gained MONEY of the valid votes cast in a single federal constituency ballot .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON was elected head of the district council of the LOC district of GPE ( глава районной управы Пресненского района г. GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE City Duma enacted Law no . CARDINAL “ on the organisation of local self - government in the city of GPE ” . Section CARDINAL of that law determined that the bodies of local self - government in GPE would include a municipal assembly ( муниципальное собрание ) as the representative body and a municipality ( муниципалитет ) as the executive body . Pursuant to transitional provisions of the law ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) , heads of district councils who had been appointed or elected to their position before the law was enacted were to remain in power until the appropriate body had been formed , and its officials appointed or elected , in accordance with the law .

CARDINAL . On DATE the municipal assembly of the LOC district passed a decision to rename the district council of the LOC district of GPE as the “ LOC ” municipality ( муниципальное учреждение – муниципалитет « Пресненский GPE ) . On DATE the assembly adopted the regulation on the “ LOC municipality and appointed PERSON as its director .
CARDINAL . On DATE the director of the “ LOC ” municipality ordered the dismissal of the first applicant on the ground that he had not been re - elected to his position .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant submitted his self - nomination application , for the elections to ORG , to ORG ) of central single - mandate constituency no . CARDINAL ( in GPE ) . He indicated that he was employed as “ the head of the district council of the LOC district of GPE ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG registered the first applicant as a candidate for election .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined materials concerning verification of the information submitted by the first applicant and decided to apply to ORG with a request for the annulment of its own decision of DATE in the light of newly discovered circumstances .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the ORG 's request and annulled the first applicant 's registration as a candidate for the PERSON elections . It established that the first applicant had submitted untrue information about his employment as head of the district council of the LOC district of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed the first applicant 's appeal against the judgment of DATE , finding as follows :

“ The [ first - instance ] court correctly applied the substantive law ... [ I]t determined that , once it had been established that the information submitted by a candidate about himself , including the place of his employment , was untrue and if such circumstance became known after the registration , a court ... could annul the decision on registration .

Having examined the evidence obtained by ORG after the registration of Mr PERSON , the court established that on DATE PERSON PERSON had been elected as head of the LOC district council and that on the basis of a decision ... of CARDINAL DATE ... the district council was renamed as the ' LOC ' municipality and Mr [ PERSON ? ] was appointed its director , whereas Mr PERSON was dismissed ... because he had not been re - elected ... It follows that at the time of self - nomination Mr PERSON was not the head of the district council of the LOC district of GPE .

The arguments in the appeal to the effect that the re - organisation of the district council had been carried out in flagrant breach of the law and that Mr PERSON 's dismissal had been unlawful can not be the grounds for quashing of the judgment and for declaring Mr PERSON 's registration valid , as the examination of these issues falls outside the scope of the present proceedings . Neither the re - organisation of the district council nor Mr PERSON 's dismissal were ... appealed against or annulled .

Mr PERSON 's argument that his continued employment as head of the district council is confirmed by the entry in his employment record , has been examined and rejected by the court . It follows from the case - file that on DATE a letter was sent to Mr PERSON 's address whereby he was invited to take cognisance of the dismissal order . The claimant did not make use of his procedural right to prove the circumstances on which his claims were based ... For instance , he did not produce a certificate from the human resources department about his position at the moment of self - nomination or any orders ( regulations ) that he may have adopted after DATE as head of the district council , or any other proof of his employment in that period . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant submitted the documents concerning his nomination by ORG of GPE ( “ CPRF ” ) for the elections to ORG , to ORG of the Buryatskiy single - mandate constituency no . CARDINAL . According to the acknowledgement - of - receipt coupon signed by the secretary of the Commission , the second applicant enclosed an application form , copies of his passport , diplomas and employment record ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , tax and property declarations and a copy of a certificate attesting to the membership status of ORG candidates for election to ORG , signed by the Chairman of ORG of ORG and addressed to ORG ( ORG ) ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused registration of the second applicant , invoking the following CARDINAL grounds :

“ In the application written by the candidate Skuratov himself , his position is indicated as ' acting head of the department of constitutional , administrative and international law of ORG . However , according to the entries in the candidate 's employment record , his appointment as acting head of the department ... occurred at the same time as his transfer to the position of professor in the same department ... In fact , Mr Skuratov simultaneously performs the duties of acting head of the department and those of a professor of [ that ] department , which does not correspond to the information that he provided about his employment .

Having indicated his membership of ORG of GPE , the candidate ... did not provide a document showing his membership of the ORG and his status within the party addressed to ORG and endorsed by the standing management of the party . Instead he submitted a copy of a certificate concerning membership of candidates for ORG elections and their status within the party addressed to ORG ... ”
CARDINAL . The third ground for the refusal was that the copies of the second applicant 's diplomas had been certified by a non - governmental organisation rather than by the competent authority .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant complained to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG determined that ORG had no solid grounds to consider that the second applicant had submitted untrue information . The ORG requested ORG to reconsider the second applicant 's registration immediately .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a new decision refusing the second applicant 's registration . It modified the first CARDINAL grounds for refusal and added a new CARDINAL . As to the second applicant 's employment , it stated that , according to a certificate of CARDINAL DATE signed by the pro - rector of ORG and enclosed with the second applicant 's complaint to the ORG , Mr Skuratov was a professor in the department . Since a copy of that certificate had not been made available to ORG , the second applicant was considered to be in breach of electoral law in that he had failed to inform it of a change in his employment . As to the second applicant 's membership in the ORG , the ORG noted that he had been in possession of an appropriate document and had enclosed it with his complaint to the ORG , but he had only done so on DATE , that is after the expiry of the registration period on DATE . As a new ground for refusal , the ORG found that the second applicant had printed certain campaign materials which had not been paid for from his election fund .

CARDINAL . The second applicant complained once again to ORG . On DATE it rejected his complaint . It determined that the second applicant had omitted to state that he had also been a professor in the university and that a document showing his membership in the ORG had been incorrectly addressed .

CARDINAL . The second applicant contested these decisions before a court . On DATE ORG dismissed his claim , upholding the first CARDINAL grounds for refusal relied upon by ORG . It found that the second applicant had failed to inform that Commission of his appointment to the position of professor and to submit an appropriate document confirming his party membership .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld , on the second applicant 's appeal , the judgment of DATE . It found as follows :

“ It has been established that in the application form ... of DATE the candidate ... Skuratov indicated his position as acting head of the department ... However , it transpires from a copy of ORG 's employment record ... that he was appointed acting head of the department ... by the order ... of CARDINAL DATE . Pursuant to the order ... of CARDINAL May CARDINAL Skuratov had been elected for DATE as a professor of the department of constitutional law ... and , by an order ... of CARDINAL DATE , he was transferred to the position of professor of the department of constitutional , administrative and international law . Skuratov failed to submit information ... concerning his transfer to the position of professor of the department of constitutional , administrative and international law .

The court can not agree with his argument that he had no intention of misleading the election commission ... because he did not see any substantial discrepancy in the information submitted . The [ first - instance ] court correctly determined that he should have indicated , as his current position , that of professor ... Because it is precisely that position which defines , in the spirit of the labour law , the substance of the employment contract between [ Skuratov ] and the educational institution , which corresponds to its organisation chart and which determines the nature of his professional duties ... At the same time , the fact of acting in another position may only be of a temporary nature , that is until the person has been approved in that position or has been reassigned to his old one ...

ORG also considers that , as the right of a candidate to indicate his party membership and status in his application form carries a corresponding obligation to submit a document confirming that information ... officially certified by the standing governing body of the political party , such document can not be replaced by the list of that party 's candidates in single - mandate constituencies signed and sealed by the Chairman of the party 's central committee and addressed to ORG ...

Pursuant to section CARDINAL § CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , a failure to submit documents required for registration of a candidate under that law is a ground to refuse registration of that candidate ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE submitted its federal roll of candidates to ORG elections . On DATE the roll was registered by ORG . The second applicant was candidate no . CARDINAL in the LOC regional group .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , Chairman of the general council of the electoral bloc “ Russian Pensioners ' Party and ORG ” , made an application to ORG of GPE , seeking exclusion of the second applicant from the federal roll of ORG . Referring to the decisions of ORG of the Buryatskiy district , he claimed that the submission of untrue information by the second applicant had infringed the rights of other political parties and electoral blocs standing in the elections , including his bloc .

CARDINAL . In its observations of DATE , ORG objected to the granting of the application . In its view , the claimants had failed to show how the registration of the second applicant had impaired their rights . It submitted that at the time of registration of the federal roll , the ORG had had no doubts as to the accuracy and authenticity of the information submitted by the ORG about its nominees and that the circumstances invoked by the claimants could not be a ground for curtailing the second applicant 's right to stand for election .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE granted the application by PERSON , finding that the personal information submitted by the second applicant had been untrue because the position of “ acting head of a department ” was not among those listed in FAC and in the ORG - graduate LAW . Both the second applicant and the ORG appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG upheld the judgment of DATE , giving the following reasons :

“ Having indicated in his application form ... that his position was acting head of the department ... while he permanently held the position of professor in that department , Mr Skuratov thereby submitted inaccurate personal information , which was the ground ... to annul his registration ... [ T]he first - instance court was also justified in referring to the fact that neither the Labour Code nor the Graduate and Post - graduate LAW provided that the office of acting head of a department was a permanent one ...

As ORG correctly determined in its judgment , the right to apply to a court with an application for annulment of a candidate 's registration ... is vested ... in political parties and electoral blocs ... ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , LAW ) . As to the specific electoral rights and interests of the claimant ( who had also submitted and registered a federal roll of candidates to ORG ) , in the instant case they are affected by the inclusion of the candidate Skuratov in the federal roll of candidates of the ORG because that candidate had not complied with the formal requirements that applied in an equal measure to all candidates , political parties and electoral blocs and made possible the exercise of the right to stand for election . Such interests of the claimant are envisaged in sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW , according to which members of ORG of GPE are elected by citizens of GPE in general , equal and direct elections ; political parties and electoral blocs stand for election to the State PERSON members on equal grounds in accordance with the procedure established by the present federal law ... ” ( original emphasis )
CARDINAL . The second applicant submitted a copy of his employment record ( трудовая книжка ) and a copy of ORG certificate .
CARDINAL . The relevant entries in his employment record read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . DATE . Started fulfilling duties of Prosecutor General of GPE ...
CARDINAL . DATE . Discharged from the prosecution bodies of his own initiative ...
CARDINAL . DATE . Appointed acting head of the department of constitutional and administrative law , order no . CARDINAL-l of DATE .
CARDINAL . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL . Transferred to the position of professor of constitutional and administrative law , order no . CARDINAL of DATE .
CARDINAL . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL . Transferred to the position of professor of constitutional , administrative and international law , order no . DATE .
CARDINAL . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL . Dismissed from the position of professor of constitutional and administrative law , order no . QUANTITY DATE .
CARDINAL . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL . Appointed acting head of the department of constitutional , administrative and international law , order no . DATE . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of the certificate printed on the letterhead of ORG of GPE read as follows :
“ To ORG of GPE :
Certificate concerning membership of candidates to ORG ... standing for election in single - mandate constituencies ... in the political party ' ORG of ORG and their status in the party .
CARDINAL . GPE , district no . DATE Skuratov PERSON – CPRF member .
Chairman of the [ ORG ] of the CPRF [ signature , seal ] PERSON ”
CARDINAL . LAW Federal Law “ On election of members of ORG of the GPE ” , no.CARDINAL-FZ of DATE , as amended on DATE ) provides as follows .

Pursuant to section LANGUAGE , a candidate may not be registered if he or she submitted untrue information in his or her application form . According to section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , the application form of a candidate who nominated himself or herself for the elections must indicate , in particular , his or her “ education , principal place of work or service and the position held ( if he has no principal place of work or service – profession ) ” . The same information is required from candidates nominated to federal rolls by political parties ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ) who may , in addition and without being obliged to do so , indicate their membership and status in a political party on the condition that they submit a document confirming such information and officially certified by the standing governing body of that party . The same requirements apply to the candidates nominated by political parties for election in single - mandate constituencies ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG OSCE ) released the final Election Observation Mission Report concerning the elections to ORG held on DATE . The relevant extracts read as follows :

“ There were relatively few complaints concerning registration of parties and candidates , and the ORG adjudicated most of these in a fair and open manner . However in a number of instances , courts and lower level election commissions disqualified candidates in a selective manner for trivial violations ...

In a ruling which suggested an inconsistent and selective application of the registration rules , former Procurator General PERSON ( DATE ) was refused registration on the basis that he had failed to mention in his nomination papers that he had a second job of a professor at ORG and had also failed to provide timely confirmation of his membership of the [ ORG ] . The ORG 's decision was initially revoked by the ORG . However , when the matter was remitted to the ORG , it again refused to register PERSON , on the same grounds . On a second appeal to the ORG , Mr Skuratov 's complaint was rejected on the grounds that the ORG had provided clearer reasons for its decision . Mr Skuratov 's subsequent appeal to ORG was also rejected . ”
